Templar slowly lifted his head. He ventilated for a nano or two, 
then turned to Windlord and nodded.

Templar: I appreciate your concern. Even if I should have been 
terminated, I am still here, so I guess the worries of this world 
are still mine to bear... By the way, my name is Templar. You are...?

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "airly2000" <airly2002@h...> wrote:
> Windlord::
> 
> Windlord hought that the femme was bot's love and he gave time to 
> him to express his feelings. After a while he said 
politely "Excuse 
> me... we follow your signal and we deduce that you're a 
maximnal... 
> one of us... I'm here to lead you to our base... In case that you 
> like it"
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic" <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> > Templar said nothing. He was alive and well, at least 
physically. 
> He 
> > grabbed the rim of the pod's hatch with one hand and pulled 
> himself 
> > free. In the other hand, though, he carried something... no, it 
> was 
> > someone, or rather had been.
> > 
> > Templar got out, carrying in his arms the shell of Umbral, a 
> slender 
> > woman-bot, locked in pain through death. A massive blasthole was 
> > centered on her chest, surrounded by smaller blaster shots on 
the 
> > rest of her body.
> > 
> > The bodyguard laid her down wordlessly and started piling leaves 
> on 
> > her. After she was covered, he kneeled and started crying 
> quietly...
> > 
> > Templar: Let this be your final resting place, dear Umbral...
> >

wrote:

halfway

> > > > > > atmosphere. Gravity shook it and pulled it directly

> > > > > > formation in the middle of an orchard.

saw

> > > > > > passing around him. He reflexively touched the controls

at
